p: Generally, evening primrose oil is obtained from Oenothera biennis seeds using the cold-pressing method. The oil is a blend of about 13 triacylglycerol fractions, where the dominant combinations consist of the following fatty acids: linoleic–linoleic–linoleic (LLL, 40%), linoleic–linoleic–γ-linolenic (LLLnγ, approximately 15%), linoleic–linoleic–palmitic (LLP, approximately 8%), and linoleic–linoleic–oleic (LLO, approximately 8%) [ 7]. The oil consists of triacylglycerols—about 98%, with a small amount of other lipids and about 1–2% non-saponifiable fraction [ 6].
